summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 20, 2019, and produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman and includes a rider detailing the recipient's rights and the scope of requested materials.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, commanding the recipient to appear and produce evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein in connection with an alleged violation of federal statutes.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to gather evidence related to Epstein for a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Grand jury appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, to testify and produce evidence regarding alleged violations of federal law related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Subpoena issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 15, 2019, compelling an unnamed recipient to appear on August 20, 2019, and produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein.
The subpoena is related to an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371, 1001, and 1519 (conspiracy, false statements, and destruction of evidence).
The subpoena demands a broad range of materials including text messages, emails, social media messages, documents, and notes concerning Epstein.
The recipient is advised of their rights, including the right to refuse to answer self-incriminating questions and the right to consult with an attorney.
The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, indicating active federal investigation by the Southern District of New York in August 2019.
